data.title: Black Country Living Museum
data.meta_description: Experience over 250 years of history, from the Industrial Revolution to post-war prosperity, through living interpretation.
data.text:
Awlroight, ow' bist?

Experience the Black Country of yesteryear as you explore over 250 years of history, from the Industrial Revolution to post-war prosperity, through living interpretation at Black Country Living Museum in Dudley in the West Midlands.

Mind yer’ head as you go underground in a drift mine, get your toes tapping to 1950s vinyl and watch clay fly at Cricket Field Brickworks. Or perhaps take part in an Edwardian school lesson – but be careful not to get the cane, bab!

Stay late for less

Every Friday night in August, we’re extending our opening hours until 8pm. Entry after 4pm is only £8.50 per person, with all your Museum favourites to enjoy.

Free returns all summer!

Whether you’ve been before or it’s your first time, we’ve got the perfect day out with an entire historic town for you to explore at Black Country Living Museum in the West Midlands.

We need your books!

We’re looking for fiction and non-fiction books printed during the 1960s or earlier to go on the shelves of our new library. Think you can help? We’re running our next drop-in day on Saturday 17 August.

Accessibility

If you wish to personalise how you read this website, click on ‘Accessibility Tools’ in the top menu to change the font, font size, colours, and to use the ‘playback’ function.

We want all of our visitors to have a bostin’ day out at the Museum and we’re working hard to make our site as accessible as possible. Read our Access Guide to plan your visit.

Stay in touch

Sign up to our newsletter to stay up to date with Black Country Living Museum.

Our next events

Kids can dig deeper into the history of the Black Country at our Young Archaeologists' and Curators' Club! Suitable for kids aged 8-15.

Become a dab-hand at woodwork and craft your own wooden butterknife or jam spreader with our experienced tutor in this family friendly workshop.
